page.title: 11INTERVIEW WITH A FARMER
page.content: THE FARMER WHOM WE INTERVIEWED WAS MR. A. WALLS WHO HAS BEEN WORKING CONNAGE FARM FOR 32 YEARS. HE WORKS THE FARM BY HIMSELF. MR. WALLS RISES AT 7.30 AND SETS ABOUT THE DAY'S WORK. HE FEEDS THE ANIMALS-CALVES, CHICKENS AND SHEEP THEN WORKS ON THE LAND. CONNAGE FARM HAS 45 CALVES. THEY WERE BOUGHT AT ABERDEEN MART. THE FARMER FEEDS THEM ON BARLEY, MEAL, HAY AND CALVES' CAKE. THE CALVES ARE KEPT ONE YEAR THEN SOLD. CROPS GROWN ARE BARLEY, OATS, POTATOES, TURNIPS AND GRASS. THE CROPS ARE PLANTED IN THE SPRING AND HARVESTED IN AUGUST OR SEPTEMBER. THE GRAIN IS STORED IN BINS AND THE STRAW IS BALED FOR WINTER BEDDING. MR. WALLS REARS OVER 6000 CHICKENS BUYING THEM AS DAY OLD CHICKS.{BY WENDY AND MARTIN WILSON.
